business.headline: Wrong member ID linked to your UAN? Here's how EPFO lets you fix itMany employees discover that their UAN has been linked to a wrong member ID, often due to job changes or data errors. EPFO has introduced an easy online method to fix this, without visiting any office.

How every day micro-payments eat into your savingsWelcome to India's new spending reality, the age of micro-payments that silently seep into your accounts and cause invisible leaks. By the end of the month, many people find their digital wallets, likePaytm, PhonePe, Google Pay, have quietly leaked hundreds and thousands of rupees.

NCR office rents are rising: What's driving commercial real estate prices up?Expressway expansions, metro lines, and upcoming airports are easing mobility while opening new economic opportunities in the NCR.

Groww shares crash 10% to hit lower circuit. Why are investors booking profits?The share price of Groww fell 10% in early trade and slipped straight to the lower circuit, a sharp contrast to the over 90% rally investors had witnessed over the past few days.

Government to release new ITR forms by January 2026. How will they impact taxpayers?What will the new ITR forms, expected by January 2026, mean for ordinary taxpayers as India shifts to the updated Income Tax Act, 2025? Have a look here.
Tenneco Clean Air Share Price: Stock makes strong debut at 27% premiumTenneco Clean Air shares listed at Rs 505 on the NSE and Rs 498 on the BSE, compared with its issue price of Rs 397.

Groww shares slump 10% after massive post-listing rally. Why is it falling today?After four straight sessions of runaway gains, the stock finally cooled off on Wednesday, down sharply in early trade. At around 9:50 am, shares of the company were down 10% to Rs 169.89 on the NSE.
Waaree Energies share price falls over 5%. Why is it down today?The stock slipped 4.26% to Rs 3,143.20 on the BSE in the opening minutes and later extended losses to trade 5.6% lower at Rs 3,089.
Sensex, Nifty trade flat; analysts urge investors to stay defensiveThe S&P BSE Sensex slipped 81.17 points to 84,591.85 at 9:22 am, while the NSE Nifty50 fell 32.40 points to 25,877.65.

Gold, silver prices drop: Will the fall continue? What investors should knowGold, silver price: The focus now is on the minutes from the Fed's latest policy meeting and key US jobs data, both of which may influence gold and silver prices in the coming days.

Tenneco Clean Air IPO listing: Strong debut or slow start? What GMP suggestsTenneco Clean Air offered 6,34,76,070 shares, but investors placed bids for 3,92,21,37,714 shares, amounting to Rs 1,55,708.87 crore, showing strong interest in the company.

Credit card EMIs: Smart tool or hidden cost?Credit card EMIs have become a common way to manage big purchases, but are they truly a smart budgeting tool or just another expense disguised as convenience?

Good news on India–US trade deal once it's fair and equitable, says Piyush GoyalSpeaking at the Indo-US Economic Summit organised by the Indo-American Chamber of Commerce in New Delhi, Piyush Goyal said negotiations are moving ahead, but a final announcement will come only when the terms are acceptable and mutually beneficial.

What is the 9-9-6 work culture Narayana Murthy wants Indians to learn from?In his latest remarks, Murthy referred to China's well-known 9-9-6 working culture, a system followed by many Chinese tech companies during their rapid growth phase.

What your health insurer's high claim settlement ratio isn't telling youHealth insurance claim settlement ratios often look impressive but hide critical details about payouts, delays, and deductions. In this special report, we unpack what the number really means for policyholders.
Sensex ends 325 points lower, Nifty closes below 26,000; IT stocks fallThe S&P BSE Sensex lost 324.96 points to close at 84,625.99, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 103.40 points to end at 25,910.05.
Fujiyama Power Systems IPO allotment: Step-by-step guide to check statusApplicants can now check whether they have received shares through the BSE website or the registrar, MUFG Intime India Pvt Ltd.

Rs 5,000 SIP vs Rs 60,000 lump sum: Which creates more wealth in 10 years?Is it wiser to invest Rs 5,000 every month, or does a yearly Rs 60,000 lump sum genuinely create more wealth in the long run? We explore the answer here.
Excelsoft Technologies IPO Opens on November 19: Check GMP and price bandFounded in 2000, Excelsoft Technologies is known for its tech-led solutions in the education and assessment industry.

Why chasing every new IPO can hurt your portfolioChasing every new IPO may feel exciting, but it often does more harm than good. Many recent listings have slipped below their issue price, showing that hype doesn't always translate into real returns.

entertainment.headline: Parineeti Chopra, Raghav Chadha name their baby boy Neer, share first pics The first photos of actor Parineeti Chopra and politician Raghav Chadha's baby boy are out now. They have named their first child Neer.

Steal: First look of Sophie Turner's heist thriller out, premiere date announced Prime Video announces the premiere of 'Steal', a six-episode financial heist thriller. The series explores the complexities of a billion-pound pension theft and its investigation.

Shriya Saran warns fans of WhatsApp impersonator, urges vigilance against scams Actor Shriya Saran has publicly warned fans and her followers about a WhatsApp impersonator contacting people using her name and photo, urging caution and immediate action.

Archana-Parmeet mobbed in Delhi; son Aaryamann says he was pushed, slapped Aaryamann Sethi recently opened up about being pushed and slapped by fans during an outing with his parents, Archana Puran Singh and Parmeet Sethi. The confession came on a recent YouTube vlog.

As You Stood By review: Lee You-mi, Jeon So-nee's show is a heavy but necessary watchRelease Date:Fri Nov 07, 2025 As You Stood By Me series review: Netflix's 'As You Stood By' explores the harsh realities of domestic abuse and societal silence. The series challenges viewers to acknowledge the moral weight of inaction and collective complicity.

Salman and Khan-daan celebrate Salim-Salma's 61st anniversary. See fresh pics Salman Khan's parents, Salim and Salma's 61st wedding anniversary celebrations were an intimate affair. Attended by close friends and family, several inside photos from the grand event have gone viral.

BB19 episode 87: Family week brings tears, truths and tensions inside the house The Bigg Boss house witnessed back-to-back confrontations after a small concern shared by Tanya triggered a major clash with Farrhana, followed by another heated argument between Malti and Shehbaz over daily chores.

Pankaj Tripathi produces Perfect Family, India's first YouTube pay model series Actor Pankaj Tripathi has turned producer with 'Perfect Family', a dramedy releasing on YouTube's new pay model. The series explores mental health in Indian families while pioneering low-cost digital distribution.

After HYBE, G-Dragon's agency plans India entry with new subsidiary: Reports Korean entertainment giants are sharpening their India focus, eyeing a booming fan economy. Galaxy Corp's planned entry signals the next big wave of K-pop expansion into the country.

Bigg Boss 19: Farhana's mother calls herself Gaurav's superfan, outsmarts Amaal Farrhana Bhatt's mother made a memorable entry in 'Bigg Boss 19' during family week. Her witty interactions with housemates like Gaurav Khanna and Amaal Mallik quickly won over housemates and fans alike, adding a fun twist to the show.

Pakistan's 'Bleed India...' strategy and Dhurandhar's explosive trailer Ranveer Singh's 'Dhurandhar' trailer combines high-octane action with a gripping take on the "thousand cuts" strategy, tracing its roots to Pakistan's political history while building a fictional, espionage-driven narrative.

Rashmika Mandanna credits partner for emotional healing amid The Girlfriend success Rashmika Mandanna, in a recent interview, spoke about her current happiness and healing, crediting her partner for his support without naming Vijay Deverakonda.

Video: Zubeen Garg gets record tribute on birthday as 25,000 artistes sing Mayabini What began as a birthday celebration evolved into history, as 25,000 artistes performed Zubeen Garg's hit song 'Mayabini', immortalising the musician's bond with Bodoland.

Jennifer Aniston makes first public appearance with boyfriend Jim Curtis Jennifer Aniston and boyfriend Jim Curtis made their first official public appearance as a couple at a Los Angeles gala, marking a major step in their relationship. The outing comes shortly after Aniston called Curtis "extraordinary" in an interview and went Instagram official with him.

The Girlfriend: Rahul Ravindran on the film that made women feel seen, empowered Director Rahul Ravindran's 'The Girlfriend' turns the spotlight on the experiences of women in toxic relationships. The film challenges industry myths about female audiences and reshapes romantic storytelling in Indian cinema.

De De Pyaar De 2 box office Day 5: Ajay Devgn's rom-com sees small recovery 'De De Pyaar De 2' saw a slight improvement on Day 5 after its steep Monday drop, but the overall box office numbers remain weak. Despite a minor weekday bump, the rom-com continues to struggle due to average audience feedback and changing post-pandemic viewing trends.

SRK, Salman Khan spark nostalgia dancing to O Oh Jaane Jaana at a wedding. Watch Shah Rukh Khan and Salman Khan fans rejoiced after a viral video showed the two superstars dancing to 'O Oh Jaane Jaana' during what appears to be a wedding celebration.

Vignesh Shivan gifts Nayanthara Rs 10 crore Rolls-Royce for her birthday. See pics Director Vignesh Shivan marked actor Nayanthara's birthday by gifting her a Rolls-Royce Black Badge Spectre, sharing images of the luxury car on social media.

Varanasi: Title dispute erupts over Rajamouli-Mahesh Babu-Priyanka Chopra film A dispute over the title rights of the upcoming film 'Varanasi' has emerged after it was learnt that it lies with CH Subba Reddy of Rama Bramha Hanuma Creations. The Rajamouli-directorial features Mahesh Babu, Priyanka Chopra and Prithviraj Sukumaran.

general news.headline: Live: After key meet, Samrat Choudhary, Vijay Sinha to remain Bihar's deputy CMsBihar New Government Formation Live: Following the NDA's sweeping victory in the Bihar Assembly polls, Nitish Kumar is poised to take the reins of the state for a record 10th term. A day before he is sworn in as Chief Minister again, the JD(U) supremo will be elected as the NDA's leader today, after which he will tender his resignation to Governor Arif Mohammad Khan as the head of the outgoing government. The oath-taking ceremony will take place on Thursday at the Gandhi Maidan in Patna. PM Narendra Modi, Union Ministers, Chief Ministers of BJP-ruled states and other top officials will be in attendance. Stay tuned with IndiaToday.in as we bring you the latest developments from Bihar.

Bangladesh to tap Interpol to get Sheikh Hasina extradited from IndiaMuhammad Yunus' interim administration is preparing to seek Interpol's assistance to get ousted PM Sheikh Hasina and former Home Minister Asaduzzaman Khan Kamal extradited from India. This comes after the two were handed death sentences by the International Crimes Tribunal.

Nobody killed Nithari children? Moninder Pandher bares all on 19-year mysteryNithari killings: Both the accused in the sensational Nithari serial killings, Surender Koli and Moninder Singh Pandher, have now been acquitted. It leaves a simple, unanswered question: Who killed the children? Pandher divulges all in a tell-all interview.

Trump's 'hua toh hua' moment: Did he defend Khashoggi's murder?Trump-MBS meet: US President Donald Trump offered a mind-boggling defence of Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman when asked about the murder of US-based journalist Jamal Khashoggi. Trump's 'things happen' remark reminds one of Congress leader Sam Pitroda's infamous 'hua toh hua' remark.

Varanasi: Title dispute erupts over Rajamouli-Mahesh Babu-Priyanka Chopra filmA dispute over the title rights of the upcoming film 'Varanasi' has emerged after it was learnt that it lies with CH Subba Reddy of Rama Bramha Hanuma Creations. The Rajamouli-directorial features Mahesh Babu, Priyanka Chopra and Prithviraj Sukumaran.

Live: Gangster Anmol Bishnoi, deported from US, to land in Delhi shortlyAnmol Bishnoi Deportation Live: Gangster Anmol Bishnoi, who was detained in California last year and kept under police custody there, is now being deported to India from Louisiana. He is scheduled to land at Delhi airport, where the NIA team is making preparations for his arrival.

Nitish Kumar to resign today, decks cleared for 10th term as Bihar CM Live UpdatesBihar New Government Formation: Nitish Kumar will submit his resignation to Governor Arif Mohammad Khan along with letters of support from all NDA partners, clearing the path for his swearing-in as Bihar Chief Minister for a record 10th term.

Shubman Gill to travel to Guwahati, not ruled out of 2nd Test vs South AfricaIndia vs South Africa: The BCCI on Wednesday confirmed that Shubman Gill would travel with the rest of the team to Guwahati. The board added that the captain has responded well to treatment after being hospitalised for a neck injury sustained in Kolkata.

Parineeti Chopra, Raghav Chadha name their baby boy Neer, share first picsThe first photos of actor Parineeti Chopra and politician Raghav Chadha's baby boy are out now. They have named their first child Neer.

Selective outrage: Judges, bureaucrats slam Rahul Gandhi's vote chori chargeThe letter addressed to Rahul Gandhi and the Congress, said that some political leaders were resorting to provocative and unsubstantiated accusations, instead of offering a genuine policy alternative.

Rs 300-crore Pune land deal probe finds irregularities, omits Parth Pawar's nameA high-level committee investigated a Rs 300 crore land deal involving a Pune firm linked to Parth Pawar. The findings reveal procedural lapses but exclude any mention of Parth Pawar.

Seven Maoists killed in Andhra Pradesh encounter day after Madvi Hidma eliminatedSeven Maoists were killed in a fresh encounter at Maredumilli in Andhra Pradesh. Police said three women were among the dead and identification is underway. The operation followed intelligence from Tuesday's Hidma encounter.

Tiger zinda hai: Big cat returns to Gujarat forest after 32 yearsForest officials have confirmed that a male tiger has been living in the Ratan Mahal Wildlife Sanctuary in Dahod district for the past nine months.

CGC University, Mohali: Where vision becomes legacy and education becomes evolutionStories of students who dare to dream, of educators who ignite curiosity, and of a community that chooses progress with purpose.

Showed no remorse: Lawyer defending Delhi bomber's aide makes damning remarkAmir Rashid Ali, accused of aiding the recent car blast near Delhi's Red Fort, owned the Hyundai i20 used in the attack and showed no remorse or guilt, his defence lawyer Smriti Chaturvedi made a dramatic comment.

8-month-pregnant Indian-origin IT analyst killed due to speeding BMW in SydneyAn eight-month-pregnant Indian-origin woman was killed in Sydney's Hornsby in a freak accident. The 33-year-old IT analyst, Samanvitha Dhareshwar, was killed by a car that was hit by a speeding BMW being driven by an Australian teen.

Mahindra XEV 9S: What we know so far about the brand's first 7-seater electric SUVMahindra's upcoming XEV 9S is set to become India's first mainstream three-row electric SUV, offering a spacious, tech-rich cabin and born-electric design ahead of its debut on November 27.

Zoho CEO's 'marry in your 20s' advice divides Internet on career vs familyZoho CEO Sridhar Vembu's advice that young entrepreneurs should marry and have kids in their 20s has sparked a debate on social media.

Vignesh Shivan gifts Nayanthara Rs 10 crore Rolls-Royce for her birthday. See picsDirector Vignesh Shivan marked actor Nayanthara's birthday by gifting her a Rolls-Royce Black Badge Spectre, sharing images of the luxury car on social media.

Air crisis: Not just emissions, Delhi's geography is its biggest enemyWhile multiple factors contribute to worsening the city's air quality, including excessive vehicular emissions, the burning of garbage incinerators, and smoke from stubble burning in neighbouring states, a significant factor behind the consistency of the pollution is the capital's natural geography.

It's terrorism, nothing else: Owaisi jabs Dr Umar's 'suicide bombing' videoAIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi launched a scathing attack on Dr Umar Nabi, the man who launched a car blast near Delhi's Red Fort, saying his actions were an act of terror and nothing else.

Stop harassing her: Pak court to cops on Indian woman who converted, married localSarabjeet Kaur from Punjab's Kapurthala and her husband Nasir Hussain filed a petition at the Lahore High Court claiming that the police were pressuring them to end their marriage.

Sundar Pichai warns AI bubble burst could shake all tech firms, including GoogleAs AI fever grips global markets, Google CEO Sundar Pichai warns that when the hype cools, even the biggest tech players may feel the chill.

Parineeti Chopra, Raghav Chadha name their baby boy Neer, share first picsThe first photos of actor Parineeti Chopra and politician Raghav Chadha's baby boy are out now. They have named their first child Neer.

Shriya Saran warns fans of WhatsApp impersonator, urges vigilance against scamsActor Shriya Saran has publicly warned fans and her followers about a WhatsApp impersonator contacting people using her name and photo, urging caution and immediate action.

sports.headline: LeBron James hints at skipping 2028 Olympics in Los Angeles, Curry's return doubtful LeBron James and Stephen Curry opened up on a podcast, revealing doubts about their Olympic futures as Team USA approaches a generational shift ahead of the 2028 Los Angeles Games, raising questions about a new era without its biggest icons.
Shubman Gill to travel to Guwahati, decision on 2nd Test participation later: BCCI Shubman Gill to travel to Guwahati, decision on 2nd Test participation later: BCCI

McGrath dropped! Australia great out of commentary duty over betting deal Australian cricket legend Glenn McGrath has withdrawn from ABC's Ashes coverage following the broadcaster's policy on betting affiliations, prompting a reshuffle in the commentary lineup ahead of the first Test in Perth.

I don't care: Zimbabwe captain stuns Pak journalist with blunt reply before tri-series Zimbabwe captain Sikandar Raza declined to rank Asian T20I teams when answering a question from a reporter in Rawalpindi. The all-rounder handled an unrelated question with unrelated question with both grace and firmness.

BCCI curators took over: Sourav Ganguly distances himself from Eden pitch saga There has been plenty of talk surrounding the Eden Gardens pitch, and Cricket Association of Bengal (CAB) president Sourav Ganguly has now clarified that BCCI-appointed curators were in charge of the surface for the upcoming Test match.

Shane Warne's magic lives on: England fans to make emotional tribute on Boxing Day England's Barmy Army is preparing a fitting tribute to honour the late Shane Warne during the Boxing Day Test at the MCG, marking the first Ashes clash at the venue since his passing and uniting fans beyond traditional rivalry.

Lightning halts Australia's training session ahead of 1st Test in Perth Australia's training session ahead of the Ashes at Perth Stadium was abruptly halted after lightning was detected in the vicinity, despite clear skies. Players and staff were immediately instructed to leave the field in accordance with safety regulations.

Bazball was designed only for Ashes in Australia: Ponting's stunning claim Former Australia captain Ricky Ponting has claimed that England's Bazball approach was crafted with a single objective: to win the Ashes in Australia. He also accused the team of being dishonest in the way they publicly speak about their aggressive style and the results it has produced.

Curacao becomes the smallest-ever nation to qualify for FIFA World Cup Curacao have become the smallest country ever to qualify for a FIFA World Cup finals after holding on for a tense 0-0 draw against Jamaica on the final day of the Concacaf qualifying campaign.

Players and staff were immediately instructed to leave the field in accordance with safety regulations.

He also accused the team of being dishonest in the way they publicly speak about their aggressive style and the results it has produced.

The horror of 19 November: A first-hand account of how a billion dreams shatteredThe morning of 19 November 2023 dawned with a sense of hope that seemed to bind the entire nation together. Billions prayed for their collective World Cup dream to finally come true. It was unlike any other day — all roads led to the Narendra Modi Stadium in Ahmedabad, where a sea of Indian fans gathered, hearts pounding, ready to witness history unfold. But as the hours wore on, it became clear that destiny had scripted a different ending.

Scotland beat Denmark 4-2 in thriller to reach first men's World Cup in 28 yearsScotland qualified for the men's World Cup for the first time in nearly three decades after two stoppage-time goals sealed a thrilling 4-2 victory over Denmark at Hampden Park.

Barron's a big fan: Trump to Ronaldo as football star attends state dinner for MBSIn an address at the state dinner on Tuesday night, Donald Trump thanked the five-time Ballon d'Or winner for attending and said that his youngest son, Barron, is a "big fan" and the 19-year-old was impressed that he got to meet the Portugal football legend.

Will desperate India bring reinforcements to counter Simon Harmer threat?India face a selection dilemma for the Guwahati Test as Shubman Gill's absence forces a rethink of their left-hand heavy batting order, pushing the team to consider in-form options like Karun Nair or Ruturaj Gaikwad to counter South Africa's spin threat.

Gambhir wasn't playing Kolkata Test: Robin Uthappa slams India coach criticsIndia's dramatic collapse to just 93 at Eden Gardens has reignited criticism of head coach Gautam Gambhir, but former India batter Robin Uthappa believes the blame is misplaced. Uthappa insists that a coach cannot be held responsible when players fail to execute their plans on the field.

Washington Sundar not a No.3 batter, India need to rethink his spot: Sourav GangulyIND vs SA: Sourav Ganguly questioned Washington Sundar's suitability as India's No. 3 in Tests and criticised the team's decision to play four spinners in the Kolkata match, urging a return to specialist top-order batters and a more balanced attack.

India A cruise to Asia Cup semis despite rare off day for Vaibhav SuryavanshiIndia A bounced back strongly after their loss to Pakistan A, easing past Oman A to reach the Asia Cup semifinals. Harsh Dubey's composed fifty and a disciplined bowling effort ensured a confident, much-needed turnaround for the squad.

India's football dream screams after embarrassing 0-1 loss to BangladeshIndia's 0–1 defeat to Bangladesh capped a tough night that summed up a wider footballing crisis. With the ISL's future uncertain and the national team bottom of their group, India's football dream feels increasingly shaky.

Harsh Dubey's composed fifty and a disciplined bowling effort ensured a confident, much-needed turnaround for the squad.

No question of sacking Gautam Gambhir, India need better pitches: Sourav GangulyFormer Indian skipper Sourav Ganguly has dismissed calls to sack Gautam Gambhir after India's Eden Gardens defeat. Instead, he believes pitches, patience and clearer planning are the real priorities as India look to correct recurring Test-match flaws.

India need to change their mindset after Kolkata Test loss: Sourav GangulyIND vs SA: India need a mindset shift after their Kolkata Test defeat, says Sourav Ganguly, who admits the Eden pitch "was not the greatest" and insists India must play on better surfaces despite their request for a turning track.

Nervous Pakistan survive Zimbabwe scare to make winning start in tri-seriesPAK vs ZIM: Pakistan survived a major scare to chase down 148 and beat Zimbabwe by five wickets in the opening match of the tri-series, thanks to Usman Khan's unbeaten 37 and Mohammad Nawaz's late heroics.

Kolkata loss no worry; no one questioned our wins on turning tracks: BhuvneshwarBhuvneshwar Kumar feels that India's loss in the first Test against South Africa at Eden Gardens in Kolkata is nothing to worry about. He also snapped back at the pitch critics, saying that it was never questioned when India were winning.

Back to original form: Babar Azam trolled after 0 vs Zimbabwe in Pakistan tri-seriesPAK vs ZIM: Babar Azam was dismissed for a duck in the T20 tri-series opener against Zimbabwe at the Rawalpindi Cricket Stadium. The dismissal sparked intense criticism and increased pressure on Pakistan's star batter.

Gavaskar quotes Ben Stokes to slam Indian pitch critics: Haranguing predictableIndia's defeat at Eden Gardens has reignited the pitch debate, but Sunil Gavaskar insists the criticism is misplaced. He says India must fix its batting approach instead of blaming turning tracks.

Bangladesh captain slammed for 'Am I Harmanpreet Kaur' remark: In your dreamsBangladesh captain Nigar Sultana Joty faced backlash after criticising Indian World Cup-winning captain Harmanpreet Kaur while denying allegations of mistreating junior players. Harmanpreet was involved in a controversy two years ago.

MS Dhoni still on-field captain of CSK, Ruturaj just on paper: Mohammad KaifMohammad Kaif believes MS Dhoni will continue as Chennai Super Kings' central leader in IPL 2026, playing a crucial mentoring and guiding role on the field, even though Ruturaj Gaikwad is the official captain.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
